item.title: Japan organises Neputa festival to revitalize its tourism industry
item.description: Tokyo Dome is the site of the Neputa festival which is usually used for baseball games.

item.title: A gradual approach on defence spending
item.description: Clues from the defence budget suggest India is gradually improving the operational efficiency of its armed forces, opting to tackle China without a rapid rise in expenditure
item.itunes:title: A gradual approach on defence spending

content:encoded.p: Clues from the defence budget suggest India is gradually improving the operational efficiency of its armed forces, opting to tackle China without a rapid rise in expenditure

item.title: Global South unity can achieve climate justice
item.description: COP27 was a starting point for these crucial institutions to revise their priorities, and align and scale up funding. We will continue to urge MDBs to increase the deployment of climate finance three-fold until 2025
item.itunes:title: Global South unity can achieve climate justice

content:encoded.p: COP27 was a starting point for these crucial institutions to revise their priorities, and align and scale up funding. We will continue to urge MDBs to increase the deployment of climate finance three-fold until 2025

item.title: Can a credible offer of peace come from Pak?
item.description: A real shot at peace would be available only when an army chief, who has consolidated his position and can ride roughshod over domestic opposition, is convinced of the dire need to liberate the country’s economic resources from the military’s grip
item.itunes:title: Can a credible offer of peace come from Pak?

content:encoded.p: A real shot at peace would be available only when an army chief, who has consolidated his position and can ride roughshod over domestic opposition, is convinced of the dire need to liberate the country’s economic resources from the military’s grip

item.title: US-China rivalry is ramping up
item.description: The United States’ move to down objects in the sky underlines anxiety about China and a hardening of stances
item.itunes:title: US-China rivalry is ramping up

item.title: The Taste with Vir: Of restaurant explosion in India, celebrity chefs and future of dining
item.description: In this week's ‘The Taste’, Vir Sanghvi writes, “At many hotels, chefs who can barely run outlets become executive chefs. At too many restaurants, the chefs do not have the requisite experience but get hired anyway because the demand is so high.”
item.itunes:title: The Taste with Vir: Of restaurant explosion in India, celebrity chefs and future of dining

content:encoded.p: In this week's ‘The Taste’, Vir Sanghvi writes, “At many hotels, chefs who can barely run outlets become executive chefs. At too many restaurants, the chefs do not have the requisite experience but get hired anyway because the demand is so high.”

item.title: Creating lasting memories: Tips to plan the perfect family vacation
item.description: From determining your budget to researching your destination and activities, this guide will provide you with the steps necessary to plan the perfect family vacation.

item.title: India opens first stage of New Delhi-Vadodara-Mumbai Expressway
item.description: India's ambitious $13 billion project of Delhi-Mumbai Expressway will eventually cut the road travel time between the country's two biggest cities in half, to 12 hours.
item.itunes:title: India opens first stage of New Delhi-Vadodara-Mumbai Expressway

content:encoded.p: India's ambitious $13 billion project of Delhi-Mumbai Expressway will eventually cut the road travel time between the country's two biggest cities in half, to 12 hours.

item.title: Ladakh to host India's first frozen-lake marathon ‘Last Run’ at Pangong Tso
item.description: Ladakh's 21km marathon, with Lukung as its starting point, will end at Maan village. 75 selected athletes from India and abroad are participating in the run, giving them an opportunity to make a bid for a Guinness world record for the world's highest frozen-lake marathon
item.itunes:title: Ladakh to host India's first frozen-lake marathon ‘Last Run’ at Pangong Tso

content:encoded.p: Ladakh's 21km marathon, with Lukung as its starting point, will end at Maan village. 75 selected athletes from India and abroad are participating in the run, giving them an opportunity to make a bid for a Guinness world record for the world's highest frozen-lake marathon

item.title: Adani row: Yet another case of history repeating itself
item.description: For the past 66 years, we have witnessed some farce being repeated in politics. The debate over Adani Group and its political relations is nothing more than an episode in this never-ending series of farces
item.itunes:title: Adani row: Yet another case of history repeating itself

content:encoded.p: For the past 66 years, we have witnessed some farce being repeated in politics. The debate over Adani Group and its political relations is nothing more than an episode in this never-ending series of farces

item.title: India can play a key role in climate cooperation
item.description: India took on a key position on the world stage by assuming the presidency of G20. This year, India will aim to provide leadership to a group of countries that comprises 85% of the world’s GDP and 60% of its population. Doing so will require determination, vision and courage. Today, Navroz K Dubash writes that India must use its presidency to push for greater cooperation to combat complex climate issues
item.itunes:title: India can play a key role in climate cooperation

content:encoded.p: India took on a key position on the world stage by assuming the presidency of G20. This year, India will aim to provide leadership to a group of countries that comprises 85% of the world’s GDP and 60% of its population. Doing so will require determination, vision and courage. Today, Navroz K Dubash writes that India must use its presidency to push for greater cooperation to combat complex climate issues
